intro: Goniostemma acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed goniostemma, is a climbing vine native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elliptical berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
